snippet: After saying its terms of service were misunderstood, the Facebook-owned photo app leaves its intentions opaque.
abstract: After saying its terms of service were misunderstood, the Facebook-owned photo app leaves its intentions opaque.

snippet: Even though Penguin maintained that it did nothing wrong, the publishing company said it was agreeing to settle because of the impending merger.
abstract: Even though Penguin maintained that it did nothing wrong, the publishing company said it was agreeing to settle because of the impending merger.

headline.main: Awaiting Merger With Random House, Penguin Settles E-Book Case

snippet: In the face of little inventory and sky-high rents, the luxury clothing brands that would normally flock to main streets like Prince and Spring are now searching out the smaller streets.
abstract: Torrent of building sales continue to take hold in SoHo area of New York City, as sparse inventory and sky-high rents are forcing luxury clothing brands and other retailers that would normally flock to main streets like Prince and Spring to search out the smaller surrounding streets.

headline.main: Building Sales Surge in SoHo, Especially on the Side Streets
headline.print_headline: Building Sales Surge In SoHo, Especially On the Side Streets

snippet: Ang Lee talks about how filming "Life of Pi" in 3-D may have changed his artistic vision as well.
abstract: Ang Lee talks about how filming "Life of Pi" in 3-D may have changed his artistic vision as well.

snippet: Banks and smaller companies also gained as investors remained confident that lawmakers would reach an agreement to avoid spending cuts and tax increases.
abstract: Stocks rally, capping off Standard & Poor's 500's best two-day run in a month, on confidence that deal will be struck in Washington to avoid spending cuts and tax increases that could hurt the economy.

headline.main: Led by Energy and Technology, Shares Rise on Hopes for Budget Accord
headline.print_headline: Led by Energy and Technology, Shares Rise on Hopes for Budget Accord

snippet: The private equity firm Cerberus Capital Management said on Tuesday that it would immediately sell its controlling stake in the Freedom Group. | Morgan Stanley is paying a $5 million fine for its role in Facebook's market debut. | Two former hedge...
abstract: The private equity firm Cerberus Capital Management said on Tuesday that it would immediately sell its controlling stake in the Freedom Group. | Morgan Stanley is paying a $5 million fine for its role in Facebook's market debut. | Two former hedge fund managers were found guilty on Monday of fraud and conspiracy. | Banks are pushing for rules that would shield them from homeowner lawsuits.

headline.main: Cerberus to Sell Gun Maker Amid Public Pressure

snippet: The pixels were barely dry on After Deadline's previous roundup of sound-alike mix-ups when the file began to fill up again. Probably a coincidence. Sti...
abstract: The pixels were barely dry on After Deadline's previous roundup of sound-alike mix-ups when the file began to fill up again. Probably a coincidence. Still, let's be more careful with those homophones. The good news is that several of these lapses were fixed in later versions.

snippet: To promote the documentary “Girl Rising,” the makers will rely on techniques often used by more traditional advertisers, including personalized ads for employees of companies viewing it online.
abstract: Tanzina Vega Advertising column describes innovative campaign for documentary Girl Rising that will target employees at 57 companies in hopes that they will support efforts to educate girls in developing countries.

abstract: Stocks rise as investors are encouraged by signs of progress in budget talks in Washington.
